replies.message: You're very welcome, Annie! We hope you have a wonderful day. -Jessica

Facebook please respond I broadcasted a live video on facebook live on Saturday Oct. 8th at 4pm. It was a broadcast of my brother's wedding. We thought it would save on facebook as all the other live videos of the day did except for the wedding. People were able to watch the live feed but now the video is gone. Is there anyway to get the video back? It seems odd that the video just disappeared yet every other video we broadcasted of the day stayed on my timeline except the wedding video. Please help. thanks

Facebook why did you deactivate my friend's account over her being targeted by perverted misogynistic men reporting her because she revealed to others to not friend them? For it being a day to appreciate women you seem to allow chauvinists to win. She's been trying to contact you through an appeal and on other social media and you have ignored it. What gives?
Indeed, you are so nice, Facebook <3

Angelica I see stuff like that as well, they ban random people and allow disgusting stuff to continue and when you report them they say it doesn't violate the TOS. It's ridiculous, and I doubt they will respond, they don't give 2 craps about it.
I really think we need to get a listing of people who are victims of this and collect all the things Facebook doesn't ban or remove and file a class action suit.
